did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Florabell Weber and Grace Felker slides, circa 1940-1985.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Personal slide collection of Florabell Weber and Grace Felker, showing them golfing, gardening, coaching field hockey, teaching gymnastics, boating and water skiing, and other activities and including images of their dogs, horses, cars, beach vacations with family, and their tourist cabins.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Weber and Felker lived on Marsh Rd. in Union, NH as early as 1941, and their slide collection indicates they were together at least into the 1980s. They owned and operated summer cabins named "Trail's End."

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Personal slide collection of Florabell Weber and Grace Felker, showing them golfing, gardening, coaching field hockey, teaching gymnastics, boating and water skiing, and other activities and including images of their dogs, horses, cars, beach vacations with family, and their tourist cabins.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Florabell Weber and Grace Felker slides, #7746. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
